result.execSummary:
The defendant Delonno Armel Myles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

02:33 PM Defendant Delonno Armel Myles appears  in custody telephonically  from Federal Prison in Pekin, IL. Attorney John Charles Bachman appears in courtroom.  Meri C. Larson  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Agreement has been reached. Defendant waives his personal appearance.

02:33 PM Defendant Delonno Armel Myles appears  in custody telephonically  from Federal Prison in Pekin, IL. Attorney John Charles Bachman appears in courtroom.  Meri C. Larson  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Agreement has been reached. Defendant waives his personal appearance.  Attorney Bachman has mailed the guilty plea form and appellate rights and defendant has returned the forms but only the appellate form was signed. Defendant plead Guilty to Count 1.   Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights.  Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Warrant quashed.
